snippet: The central bank lowered two benchmark interest rates by a quarter percentage point after weak numbers for trade and inflation were posted.
abstract: China's central bank, in response to weaker-than-expected trade and inflation numbers, says it will cut two benchmark interest rates by a quarter percentage point in effort to spur lending and lift slowing economy.

byline.original: By DAVID BARBOZA and KEITH BRADSHER
byline.contributor: David Barboza reported from Shanghai, and Keith Bradsher from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: The central bank lowered two benchmark interest rates by a quarter percentage point after weak numbers for trade and inflation were posted.

headline.main: China Cuts Rates to Halt a Slide in Its Economy
headline.print_headline: China Cuts 2 Benchmark Interest Rates, Aiming to Lift a Weakening Economy
